00038 struct parse_exception : public std::exception
00039 {
00040   string error;
00041   parse_exception(string s) : error(s)
00042   {}
00043   
00044   virtual const char* what() const throw() 
00045   { return error.c_str(); }
00046   
00047   virtual ~parse_exception() throw()
00048   {}
00049 };
00050 
00051 #define D_FATAL_ERROR(s) { D_FATAL_ERROR2(s,  __FILE__, to_string(__LINE__)); throw 0; }
00052 
00053 #define INPUT_ERROR(s) { cout << "There was a problem in your input file:\n" << s << endl; exit(1); }
00054 // These functions are defined in debug_functions.cpp
00055 
00056 extern bool debug_crash;
00057 void D_FATAL_ERROR2(string s, string file, string line);
00058 void _NORETURN FAIL_EXIT(string s = "");
00059 
00060 struct assert_fail {};
00061 
00062 void assert_function(BOOL x, const char* a, const char* f, int line);
00063 
00064 // Unlike Asserts, Checks are always enabled.
00065 #define CHECK(x, y) {assert_function(x, y, __FILE__, __LINE__);}
00066 
00067 #ifdef MINION_DEBUG
00068 
00069 #define BOUNDS_CHECK
00070 
00071 #define D_ASSERT(x) assert_function(x, #x, __FILE__, __LINE__);
00072 #define D_DATA(x) x
00073 
00074 enum DebugTypes
00075 { DI_SOLVER, DI_SUMCON, DI_BOOLCON, DI_ANDCON, DI_ARRAYAND, DI_QUEUE, DI_REIFY,
00076   DI_LEXCON, DI_TABLECON, DI_TEST, DI_DYSUMCON, DI_DYNAMICTRIG, DI_DYELEMENT, DI_INTCON, DI_LONGINTCON,
00077   DI_INTCONTAINER, DI_BOUNDCONTAINER, DI_GACELEMENT, DI_CHECKCON, DI_VECNEQ, DI_MEMBLOCK, DI_POINTER,
00078   DI_OR, DI_GADGET
00079 };

00081 #define DEBUG_CASE(x) case x: std::cerr << #x; break;

00088 
00089 inline bool DOMAIN_CHECK(BigInt v)
00090 { return v < DomainInt_Max && v > DomainInt_Min; }
00091 
00092 // These are just to catch cases where the user didn't cast to BigInt
00093 // themselves, which makes the function useless.
00094 inline void DOMAIN_CHECK(DomainInt);
00095 inline void DOMAIN_CHECK(int);
00096 inline void DOMAIN_CHECK(unsigned int);
